intro: Pedilanthus smallii, commonly known as the dwarf arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweed and other toxic plants. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by follicles containing seeds. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and stems, adapted to arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
